dc_title_s: Shuttle Radar Topography Mission (SRTM) Digital Elevation Model, 2008
dc_description_s:
Shuttle Radar Topography Mission (SRTM) Digital Elevation Model is a raster model representing elevations word wide (between 60 degrees North and 56 degrees South latitude).  The resolution is 3 arc seconds (90 meters). The pixel value represents the elevation in meters.

The version of the SRTM 3-arc-second data that served as the basis for the SRTM Global Digital Elevation Model data is the Version 2 "Finished" data in DTED Level 1 format that was created by NGA by subsampling SRTM 1-arc-second data.
dc_creator_sm: United States. National Aeronautics and Space Administration
